trans: 禁不住（哭起来或笑起来）

tr: (film) a gradual transition from one scene to the next
the next scene is gradually superimposed as the former scene fades out

example: The President dissolved the parliament and called for new elections

tr: bring the association of to an end or cause to break up
example: The decree officially dissolved the marriage
the judge dissolved the tobacco company

tr: become or cause to become soft or liquid
example: The giant iceberg dissolved over the years during the global warming phase
The sugar quickly dissolved in the coffee

tr: cause to go into a solution
example: The recipe says that we should dissolve a cup of sugar in two cups of water
dissolve a shot or a picture
She dissolved into tears when she heard that she had lost all her savings in the pyramid scheme
The news dissolved her into tears

tr: stop functioning or cohering as a unit
example: The political wing of the party dissolved after much internal fighting

partsOfSpeech.dec: dis- 否定 + advantage n.有利条件
dis- 否定 + appear v.进入视野
dis- 否定 + aster 星
dis- 否定 + cover v.盖
dis- 否定 + honest adj.诚实的
dis- 否定 + like prep.像
dis- 否定 + agree v.同意 + -ment 行为或结果
dis- 否定 + appoint v.任命
dis- 否定 + obey v.服从
dis- 否定 + -able 可...的
dis- 否定 + agree v.同意
dis- 否定 + charge 装载
dis- 否定 + courage n.勇气
dis- 否定 + ease n.容易
dis- 否定 + guise 伪装,相似
dis- 否定 + gust 美味;口味
dis- 否定 + miss 送出,投掷
dis- 否定 + order 命令;顺序
dis- 否定 + put 想 + -e
dis- 否定 + satisfy v.使满意
dis- 否定 + regard v.看待
dis- 否定 + grace 优雅;光彩
dis- 否定 + rupt 打破,破裂
dis- 否定 + tort 卷缩

data.enText: to mix with a liquid and become part of it
Heat gently until the sugar dissolves.
data.chText: 慢慢加热直到糖溶解为止。

data.enText: to make a solid become part of a liquid
to officially end a marriage, business agreement or parliament
data.chText: 解除（婚姻关系）；终止（商业协议）；解散（议会）
他们于 1999 年解除了婚姻关系。

data.enText: The election was announced and parliament was dissolved.
data.chText: 宣布选举后，议会解散了。

data.enText: to disappear; to make sth disappear
When the ambulance had gone, the crowd dissolved.
data.chText: 救护车离开后人群便散了。

data.enText: His calm response dissolved her anger.
data.chText: 他平静的回答化解了她的怒气。

data.enText: to suddenly start laughing, crying, etc.
data.chText: 禁不住（笑起来或哭起来等）

data.enText: When the teacher looked up, the children dissolved into giggles.
data.chText: 教师抬头看时，孩子们不禁格格笑起来。

data.enText: Every time she heard his name, she dissolved into tears.
data.chText: 每当听到他的名字时，她都禁不住泪流满面。

data.enText: to remove or destroy sth, especially by a chemical process; to be destroyed in this way
data.chText: （以化学手段）除去，分散；（被）破坏

data.enText: a new detergent that dissolves stains
All the original calcium had dissolved away.
data.chText: 所有原始钙都被破坏了。

simple_means.memory_skill: dis- 否定 + solv 松开 + -e

means: 禁不住(笑起来或哭起来等)
(电影、电视等画面的)渐隐，溶暗

ex.enText: At what temperature can the glass melt?
ex.chText: 玻璃在什么温度下会熔化？

synonyms.bx: 指物质由固体变成液体。

ex.enText: Don't dissolve the tablet in water.

synonyms.bx: 指某种固体物质溶解于液体中。

ex.enText: Brass can be made by fusing copper and zinc.
ex.chText: 通过熔合铜和锌可以得到黄铜。

ex.enText: Which metal will fuse at a low temperature?

synonyms.bx: 尤指在高温下石头、金属等熔为液体。

ex.enText: The lake thawed early this year.

example.ex: Heat gently until the sugar dissolves...
example.tran: 慢慢加热直到糖溶解为止。

example.ex: Dissolve the salt in a little boiled water.
example.tran: 将盐溶解在少许开水中。

value.def: If a substance dissolves in liquid or if you dissolve it, it becomes mixed with the liquid and disappears.

example.ex: The King agreed to dissolve the present commission.
example.tran: 国王同意解散目前的委员会。

value.def: When an organization or institution is dissolved, it is officially ended or broken up.

example.ex: The present assembly will be dissolved on April 30th...
example.tran: 现在的议会将于 4 月 30 日解散。

example.ex: Kaifu threatened to dissolve the Parliament and call an election.
example.tran: 卡夫威胁要解散议会并举行选举。

value.def: When a parliament is dissolved, it is formally ended, so that elections for a new parliament can be held.
When a marriage or business arrangement is dissolved, it is officially ended.
value.tran: 解除(婚姻关系）；终止（商业协议)

example.tran: 他刚刚萌生的乐观情绪消失了。

example.ex: Lenny still could not dissolve the nagging lump of tension in his chest.
example.tran: 莱尼仍不能消除令他不安的紧张感。

value.def: If something such as a problem or feeling dissolves or is dissolved, it becomes weaker and disappears.

trans: （使）溶解在…；在…遮盖下变得模糊，消失；因…失去控制
